tit.e: Hari (needle)-kuyo (a memorial service for dull and broken needles)

Hari (needle)-kuyo (a memorial service for dull and broken needles)

sen.j: 針供養（はりくよう）は、折れた縫い針を供養し、近くの神社に収める行事。
sen.e: Hari (needle)-kuyo is an event to hold a memorial service for broken sewing needles and offer them to a shrine.
Hari (needle)-kuyo is an event to hold a memorial service for broken sewing needles and offer them to a shrine nearby.
sen.cmt: ”近くの”という部分を補いました。
sen.e: Hari (needle)-kuyo is an event to hold a memorial service for broken sewing needles and offer them to a shrine nearby.

sen.j: 主に淡島神社（粟島神社）または淡島神を祀る堂（淡島堂・粟島堂）がある寺院で行われる。
sen.e: The event is mainly held at temples that have an Awashima-jinja Shrine or an Awashima-do Hall where an Awashima-no-kami is enshrined.
The event is mainly held at temples that have Awashima-do Hall which enshrines Awashima-jinja Shrine or Awashima-no-kami.
sen.cmt: 原文に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The event is mainly held at temples that have Awashima-do Hall which enshrines Awashima-jinja Shrine or Awashima-no-kami.

sen.j: 2月8日（関西地方では12月8日）に行われる。
sen.e: The hari-kuyo event is held on February 8 (December 8 in the Kansai region).

sen.j: 折れた針を神社に納めたり、豆腐や蒟蒻のようにやわらかいものに刺したりすることで供養し、裁縫の上達を祈った。
sen.e: People hold the service by offering broken needles to a shrine or sticking them in soft materials such as tofu or konnyaku (a gelatinous food made from devil's-tongue starch) and pray that their sewing will become proficient.
